title: Excellent
comment: Thanks for the excellent app.

I have added a feature where a new line in Add Task can copy the tags and lists of the previous line. I tried it on my phone and tablet and like it so much that it will be in the next release. Adding multiple tasks to the same list is now just:
Task 1 @@list {enter}
Task2 {enter} etc. etc.
Braindumping is about as painless as possible now.

title: Tried many other top task apps (including pro)...
comment: Simpletask is the best! Love that it's local text data, no cloud. PRO: Lightweight app, highly functional (recurring tasks, sort, saved tag/script filter, archive, share, Tasker intents). Supports multiple line task titles in the app and widget list views. (Other popular task apps truncate to one line in the list view). Easy to manage "database" size. Flexible, quick learn, easy on the eyes, 4x4 scrollable widget. 👍Widget options saved.  CON: Needs widget check boxes.
Adding checkboxes is on the roadmap. Time permitting it will be added.

title: Very Good
comment: It has options for sorting and filtering.  It is offline. REQUEST: Can we have "Larger/Huge" for Font Size option and the Completion Checkbox is larger as well? Thanks.
Larger/Huge should be easy. The check boxes are part of the default theme so that's hard to change. This is why I disable check boxes and use complete from the menu after selecting tasks.

This is amazing app. Uses todo.txt format with basic extensions as due:. I am syncing my todo.txt across my devices using syncthing / btsync and it just works. What is great: * follows GTD methodology * list and tag suggestions when creating a new task * you can have multiple widgets with specific "views" * GUI theme is customizable (You can use dark theme if it is installed) * it just works, it's fast and it doesn't get in Your way * it's FREE  What I miss: * ability to set font size in widget * only 3 font sizes in app * show only list of specified type in task text, for example, I want to see all lists (like @call, @mail ...) in task text except for @com1
Thanks for the kind words. I am planning to change the display backend so you can use Lua scripts to change the display text. This will allow your last use case to be implemented.

title: Amazing
comment: I like it because there are many options for filtering and sorting and it is offline (no network access).
a fork of todo.txt that is just oh so gooood

title: Thumbs up
comment: Todo.txt format + easy-to-customise filtering + let's me handle syncing = an ideal to do list / task manager
Great app. Fast, simple and powerful at the same time. After trying many task applications, this is the best for me.
id love a calendar view. it's hard to manage with setting items in a second step through Google.
Synchronisation of dates to calendar has been merged and will be in the next release.

title: Simple, effective, libre/free!
comment: It is a perfect task solution. Works great and is GPLv3 free/libre software. Perfect combination.

title: Very easy to use
comment: As long as you understand todo.txt, this tool with be amazing. I have gone through so many proprietary todo apps/services and have finally found one that is open and not bound to a service. thanks!

title: Best TODO list app.
comment: Simple and with every essential feature you might need in an app of this type (...except maybe proper recurrent notifications).  I use it in combination with Syncthing to keep the todo.txt in sync between several of my devices. I prefer doing it this way rather than using the dropbox version of this app.  The fact that the file is simply a txt editable everywhere makes it very portable and interesting,

title: Excellent
comment: I've gone through several task/to-do apps, and this is by far my favorite and the one that just "works." Great app for gtd. Love the minimalistic design, and it runs quickly without hiccups. Developer was very prompt and helpful through email for a few questions I had. Given the many task managers on the play store, it took a while for me to find this app, but I'm glad I did and I hope others looking for a clean and proper gtd all do too.

title: Best task manager I have found
comment: Have tried many to do / task / GTD type systems and for me this is the best and most flexible. Excellent widget.  Synced with owncloud.
Good  but confusing ui   help appreciateed
An introduction video would help, but I haven't gotten to this yet. You can always ask me questions by email or on github.

title: Great App
comment: Easy to use, simple, exactly what I need. It would be amazing if complete date has a timestamp associated so we can see tasks listed in the order of completion.

Unfortunately, the todo.txt format doesn't support completion timestamps. Of course one could always define an extension for it, but I don't think that is a good way to take for something as fundamental as this.

title: The best GTD app
comment: Definitely the best GTD app compatible with todo.txt. Adjustable list appearance and rich filtering options. Really recommend if you're looking for this kind of app.
Perfect in its simplicity

title: Good app
comment: You must develop this. Very good

title: Perfect
comment: I like tags, list features for sorting notes. It's quick to work with on old devices too, which is awesome

title: This is so totally perfect for the privacy conscious.
comment: App has no network access, so you can leave that to a file-syncing tool like Seafile's android client (an open source dropbox clone that does client-side encryption). Wahoo! I'm definitely donating to this guy. Aaaaaand it's open source too. Perfect perfect perfect. (Please move the tracker to GitHub so this project can get the contributors it deserves.) Been using the official todo.txt for awhile, but switching immediately
Github issues has been enabled so you can log issues there as well. I will slowly move the other issues from Redmine to github.

title: It's open source, too!
comment: Finally, an alternative to Astrid and co with no risk of going down or disappearing from the surface of the Earth! The addition of recurrence makes it just as versatile as proprietary tools like Astrid was, TickTick and others are now. (Now if only I could find something as user-friendly as Simpletask Cloudless for my desktop...)
Simpletask desktop is still in my todo.txt :) If there is any progress you can check it at: http://github.com/mpcjanssen/simpletask-tcl

title: nice app ... but ...
comment: for the record, i have uninstalled this app. but marcj, the dev, is very responsive. this app is an implementation of gina trapani's todo.txt which is a way of doing gtd. if u are interested in learning and using those concepts, this may be the app you are looking for.

Just start adding tasks with the plus icon. This will give you the basic task features. A tutorial is work in progress. But a good step in understanding how it works is to google todo.txt. This is the task format that is used.
Finally a good todo app that doesn't lock me into a proprietary 'cloud' storage provider, yet still allows me to use my own methods for sharing the todo list between devices. Well done

title: Little Great App!
comment: It doesn't require a bunch of permissions like most of to-do apps, it's simple and amazingly useful.

title: Amazing! Lets you go off the grid.

comment: works with todo.txt sorry gina

title: Really cool !
comment: One thing is missing for me though - the support for taskpaper format. Could you please please add it ? It's very similar to todo.txt but more convenient for some users. Like me )

Considering how intimately linked the app and the todo.txt format are, supporting a different format will be non trivial. So don't expect any different formats any time soon. I am open to the idea though so will look into it. See http://mpcjanssen.nl/fossil/simpletask/tktview/192e526b9d
Great!

title: 5 Stars are not enough
comment: If possible I would give it 6 or more. Finally a todo app that fits my needs.
Simple but does it all

title: Nice work Mark! Keep it on!
comment: - plain text file-based storage, very easy to export/import/parse. - less privacy concerns since the data ate at your hands. - lists are a great way to categorize tasks

title: Awesome!
comment: No more Dropbox needed... Wish I'd found this sooner. Very clean interface.

title: Respects my freedom
comment: This is much better than the official todo.txt client that uses Dropbox

This is exactly why I created this version and consider it the evolution of the dropbox version. It's up to you if and how you want to sync your todo file.
With the new gradle build system for the dropbox version I can now use the same code base for all version, so expect some of the newer goodies to be added to this version soon.
simple program to create to do list
